==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|どう|じん|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=とうじん'}} compound {{m|ltc|同人|tr=*dhung *njin}}. Compare modern {{cog|zh|同人|tr=tóngrén}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|ど|うじん}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[do̞ːd͡ʑĩɴ]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|どうじん}}

# the [[same]] person
# [[that]] person, the same person as previously mentioned
# a person or persons of the same [[interest]]s or [[passion]]s: a [[coterie]] or a [[member]] of a coterie, a [[fan]]
# a [[scholar]] or scholars belonging to the same [[school]] of [[thought]]
# the [[thirteenth]] [[hexagram]] of the [[I Ching]], known as "Concording People": <span style="font-size:larger;">☰☲</span>

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|同人雑誌|どうじんざっし|dōjin zasshi}}: a [[fan]] [[magazine]]
* {{ja-l|同人誌|どうじんし|dōjinshi}}: short for ''dōjin zasshi'': a [[fan]] [[magazine]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|どう|にん|yomi=on}}
Same as above, only using the older [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']] reading of ''nin'' for {{ja-l|人}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|ど|うにん}}<ref name="DJR"/>
* {{ja-accent-common|a|ど|うにん}}<ref name="DJR"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[do̞ːnĩɴ]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|どうにん}}

# the [[same]] [[person]]
# [[that]] person, the same person as previously mentioned
# {{lb|ja|sort=どうにん|rare}} a person or persons of the same [[interest]]s or [[passion]]s: a [[coterie]] or a [[member]] of a coterie, a [[fan]]

=====Usage notes=====
Generally speaking, the ''dōnin'' reading appears to be used less often than ''dōjin''. Note also that ''dōnin'' has fewer senses.<ref name="DJR"/><ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|同人雑誌|どうにんざっし|dōnin zasshi}}: a [[fan]] [[magazine]]
* {{ja-l|同人誌|どうにんし|dōninshi}}: short for ''dōnin zasshi'': a [[fan]] [[magazine]]
{{der-bottom}}
